source: It's what's inside that count.

feedback_explanation: When talking about something that started in the past and continues until now, it is necessary to use the present perfect tense (have/has + past participle of the verb).

source: I think I am right for the position because I think I can boost the motivation of people about movies and push them up to share their particular point of view.
corrected: I think I am right for the position because I think I can boost the motivation of people about movies and push them [NONE] to share their particular point of view.
feedback_explanation: Rather than "push up," it is better to use "push" by itself here to mean "urge."

source: I was so angry, because I was finishing the puzzles and five pieces were missing. So I began to search the whole house for the five pieces but didn't find them.
corrected: I was so angry, because I was finishing the puzzle and five pieces were missing. So I began to search the whole house for the five pieces but didn't find them.
feedback_explanation: Puzzles is plural here, but it seems like you are talking about only one.

source: As far as television is concerned, well, being honest, I haven't watched much TV for years.
corrected: As far as television is concerned, well, to be honest, I haven't watched much TV for years.
feedback_explanation: The infinitive form is required here to act as an adverbial modifier for the verb "honest."
feedback_suggestion: Change the word "being" to its infinitive form.

source: But living in the 21st century, it's difficult to blame science when we are benefited through its technological applications in our everyday life to an ever - great extent.
corrected: But living in the 21st century, it's difficult to blame science when we are benefited through its technological applications in our everyday life to an ever - greater extent.
feedback_explanation: When making a comparison between two things, it is necessary to use the comparative form of the adjective.

source: Also, I think I would be a good person for the job because I like nature. I could teach them a lot of things about the Geology, a camp is perfect for introducing the boys and girls to stones and minerals.
corrected: Also, I think I would be a good person for the job because I like nature. I could teach them a lot of things about [NONE] Geology, a camp is perfect for introducing the boys and girls to stones and minerals.
feedback_explanation: No article is required to talk about proper nouns.

source: As technology develops rather rapidly, it's a world - wide phenomenon now for us to find that large - scale buildings and transport networks are to be built for the sake of human 's economy, which means vast areas of farmland, forest and wetland are on the way to being ruined.
corrected: As technology develops rather rapidly, it's a world - wide phenomenon now for us to find that large - scale buildings and transport networks are to be built for the sake of human [NONE] economy, which means vast areas of farmland, forest and wetland are on the way to being ruined.
feedback_explanation: The noun "human" is simply modifying the noun "economy" so the possessive is not required.

source: But after the first song, when the audience started to sing and dance, our manager came to us and told us that we can go see the concert.
corrected: But after the first song, when the audience started to sing and dance, our manager came to us and told us that we could go see the concert.
feedback_explanation: Use "could" to talk about an action or event that was allowed in the past.

source: I suggest you choose college students, because they are more familiar with English. Besides, they will welcome you with pleasure to practise their English skills. When you use public transportation, you can ask for the information you need from the official employee in the station or from student for the same reason; not many Indonesians speak English.
corrected: I suggest you choose college students, because they are more familiar with English. Besides, they will welcome you with pleasure to practise their English skills. When you use public transportation, you can ask for the information you need from the official employee in the station or from students for the same reason; not many Indonesians speak English.
feedback_explanation: It seems that you are talking about more than one student, so a plural is necessary.

source: What I liked most was that you think you know what is going to happen, but for your surprise, it always turns out to be something unexpected.
corrected: What I liked most was that you think you know what is going to happen, but to your surprise, it always turns out to be something unexpected.
feedback_explanation: The correct expression is "to (one's) surprise."
feedback_suggestion: Change "for" to "to" to fix the expression.

source: First of all, finishing high school is a passege of life that indicates the beginning of a new chapter for students.
corrected: First of all, finishing high school is a rite of passage that indicates the beginning of a new chapter for students.
feedback_explanation: It seems that you are thinking of the collocation "rite of passage."
feedback_suggestion: Change the phrase "passege of life" to "rite of passage."

source: While designing fun activities, the camp workers have to take into concerns the safety level of those activities, the possible harm and the protection and treatment supplies that might be needed.
corrected: While designing fun activities, the camp workers have to take into account the safety level of those activities, the possible harm and the protection and treatment supplies that might be needed.
feedback_explanation: It seems that you are thinking of the collocation "take into account."

source: The future of public transport should be taken seriously. In my opinion, public transport is the best option for solving the problems with traffic congestion because, when we use a bus or subway, a lot of people is travelling from one place to other in just one vehicle.
corrected: The future of public transport should be taken seriously. In my opinion, public transport is the best option for solving the problems with traffic congestion because, when we use a bus or subway, a lot of people are travelling from one place to other in just one vehicle.
feedback_explanation: People is plural, but "is" is only used with a singular subject.
feedback_suggestion: Change "is" to a form that goes with a plural subject.

source: From the 1980's, it is developed as an international financial centre and so many global investors have set up their headquarters there.
corrected: From the 1980's, it has been developed as an international financial centre and so many global investors have set up their headquarters there.
feedback_explanation: When talking about something that started in the past and continues until now, the present perfect tense is necessary.
feedback_suggestion: Change "is developed" to the present perfect.

source: So TV could become a useful tool in the educational process if more effort is put into this, from the television programming to the preference of society.
corrected: So TV could become a useful tool in the educational process if more effort was put into this, from the television programming to the preference of society.
feedback_explanation: Use the past tense with an "if" statement to talk about a hypothetical situation.
feedback_suggestion: Change the word "is" to its past tense form.

source: It is very exciting that entertainment and education can be merged for accomplish the spread of knowledge among the masses in an enjoyable way.
corrected: It is very exciting that entertainment and education can be merged to accomplish the spread of knowledge among the masses in an enjoyable way.
feedback_explanation: You can't use "for accomplish" to express purpose. A to-infinitive is necessary here.
feedback_suggestion: Change "for" to "to" to make this into a to-infinitive.

source: However, I do not agree with them, because in most parts of the world mass transport systems are still popular and they are environment friendly and cost - efficient.
corrected: However, I do not agree with them, because in most parts of the world mass transport systems are still popular and they are environmentally friendly and cost - efficient.
feedback_explanation: You require an adverb to modify this clause, but "environment" is a noun.
feedback_suggestion: Change the word "environment" to its adverb form.

source: For example, I can watch a lot of matches a day and I enjoy it when I watch famous players such [NONE] Cristiano Ronaldo for Real Madrid and Messy for Barcelona.
corrected: For example, I can watch a lot of matches a day and I enjoy it when I watch famous players such as Cristiano Ronaldo for Real Madrid and Messy for Barcelona.
feedback_explanation: The phrase "such as" is used to give examples.
feedback_suggestion: Add "as" to make this into "such as."

source: Not to mention the social bonding ability of it, while game tension between the opposing teams is somewhat inevitable, the irreverent, human, no - strings - attached nature of streetball events always compensate [NONE] its negative aspects which, upon closer inspection, appear to be shared between every single sports event.
corrected: Not to mention the social bonding ability of it, while game tension between the opposing teams is somewhat inevitable, the irreverent, human, no - strings - attached nature of streetball events always compensate for its negative aspects which, upon closer inspection, appear to be shared between every single sports event.
feedback_explanation: When used in this way, "compensate" needs a preposition, "for," to connect to its object.

source: At 2 p.m. my mum decided to go to the hospital because I couldn't understand anything and I ca n't talk.
corrected: At 2 p.m. my mum decided to go to the hospital because I couldn't understand anything and I could n't talk.
feedback_explanation: Use the word "could" to talk about past ability.

source: The serious side of nuclear power is the dangerous weapons that countries try to own, which threat the peace in the world.
corrected: The serious side of nuclear power is the dangerous weapons that countries try to own, which threaten the peace in the world.
feedback_explanation: Threat is a noun, but a verb is necessary here.

source: Television series, contests, movies, and news which do it all the time without us being aware of it.
corrected: Television series, contests, movies, and news [NONE] do it all the time without us being aware of it.
feedback_explanation: This "which" makes the whole sentence into a relative clause, but a sentence must always have a main clause first.
feedback_suggestion: Consider removing "which" so the sentence has a main clause.

source: One thing leads to another and we ended up having a beer and laughing in a pub.
corrected: One thing led to another and we ended up having a beer and laughing in a pub.
feedback_explanation: Use the simple past to refer to actions or events that happened in the past.
feedback_suggestion: Change the word "leads" to its simple past form.

source: The environment is our surroundings. There is no awareness in our locality. They are busy with their own work. No one focuses on or sees what [NONE] happening in our town. They usually speak about how hot it is today, but they don't know what makes it this hot. I am interested in planting trees and making our surroundings clean. Some people used to burn the forest as if the forest is useless. Man is greedy because all the things we get from the forests are free.
corrected: The environment is our surroundings. There is no awareness in our locality. They are busy with their own work. No one focuses on or sees what is happening in our town. They usually speak about how hot it is today, but they don't know what makes it this hot. I am interested in planting trees and making our surroundings clean. Some people used to burn the forest as if the forest is useless. Man is greedy because all the things we get from the forests are free.
feedback_explanation: To talk about something that is happening now, use the present continuous tense with "be + verb (-ing form)."
feedback_suggestion: Add a form of the verb "be" before "happening."

source: I have no particular problem helping them, but I often have some doubts to suggesting a place to go shopping.
corrected: I have no particular problem helping them, but I often have some doubts about suggesting a place to go shopping.
feedback_explanation: The verb "doubt" uses "about" to connect to its object, not "to."

source: The Internet has also replaced television to watching films and TV shows, especially among young people, who prefer to download and watch videos instead of watching to the fixed schedule of TV.
corrected: The Internet has also replaced television for watching films and TV shows, especially among young people, who prefer to download and watch videos instead of watching to the fixed schedule of TV.
feedback_explanation: Use the word "for" to connect a purpose noun to the preceding word "television."

source: Your thoughts are the only ones that will make the difference, so take care only of them and believe in yourself so you could achieve the prestige you're looking for.
corrected: Your thoughts are the only ones that will make the difference, so take care only of them and believe in yourself so you can achieve the prestige you're looking for.
feedback_explanation: Use the word "can" to talk about current abilities.

source: We had been told earlier that Abul kaka had got a very nice PAJERO Jeep from the office nonetheless the performance of the vehicle was awful that day.
corrected: We had been told earlier that Abul kaka had got a very nice PAJERO Jeep from the office . Nonetheless , the performance of the vehicle was awful that day.
feedback_explanation: Nonetheless can't link the two parts of this sentence. Right now, this is a run-on sentence. It must be broken up or connected more smoothly.
feedback_suggestion: Consider ending the sentence here and starting a new one with "Nonetheless, ..."

source: We left our city on Monday, and we arrived [NONE] Carlos Paz on Thursday.
corrected: We left our city on Monday, and we arrived in Carlos Paz on Thursday.
feedback_explanation: Use the word "in" to mark the location where an event such as "arrived" occurred.

source: A lot of young mans love wearing jeans and a T - shirt.
corrected: A lot of young men love wearing jeans and a T - shirt.
feedback_explanation: The plural form of "man" is "men."

source: I have experience to going to the hospital and it was very interesting.
corrected: I have experience of going to the hospital and it was very interesting.
feedback_explanation: Use the word "of" to show that the noun "going" is a property or status of "experience."

source: Nobody can tell how, when, where and what will happen in the next 50 years of our life.
corrected: Nobody can tell how, when, where and what will happen in the next 50 years of our lives.
feedback_explanation: Life is singular here, but you seem to be talking about more than one.

source: These were my first feeling when I made the mistake.
corrected: These were my first feelings when I made the mistake.
feedback_explanation: You seem to be talking about more than one "feeling," so you need the plural form here.
feedback_suggestion: Change the word "feeling" to its plural form.

source: When you practise any sport, you have to be confident in yourself, without confidence you will not have any progress.
corrected: When you do any sport, you have to be confident in yourself, without confidence you will not have any progress.
feedback_explanation: Practise is not the most natural word to use with "sport." "Do" and "play" are more common.

source: Finally, authentic materials in foreign languages was not found in the school's library.
corrected: Finally, authentic materials in foreign languages were not found in the school's library.
feedback_explanation: Materials is a plural subject, but "was" can only be used with the singular.
feedback_suggestion: Change "was" to a form that goes with a plural subject.

source: Secondly, the student who has a good body shape can easily make new friends, and joining a sports team allows students to maintain [NONE] good body shape.
corrected: Secondly, the student who has a good body shape can easily make new friends, and joining a sports team allows students to maintain a good body shape.
feedback_explanation: You do not seem to be talking about a particular "good body shape," so you should use an indefinite article here.

source: Therefore, public transport play an important role in mitigating global warming.
corrected: Therefore, public transport plays an important role in mitigating global warming.
feedback_explanation: The subject, "public transport," is third-person singular. The verb must be in a different form to go with it.
feedback_suggestion: Change "play" to a form that goes with a third-person singular subject.

source: I definitely recommend that album to your collection.
corrected: I definitely recommend that album for your collection.
feedback_explanation: The preposition "for" is used with nouns to show why something is done.

source: Finally, if you drive a car, you don't have to care about a timetable. You can go at any time.
corrected: Finally, if you drive a car, you don't have to worry about a timetable. You can go at any time.
feedback_explanation: You seem to mean "worry" here.
feedback_suggestion: Change the word "care" to the word "worry."

source: The reason is, three days ago, he had been working when a girl at his work asked him whether he had a girlfriend and he said 'I had one, come on, you know my ex - girlfriend', then she just walked away without tell anything.
corrected: The reason is, three days ago, he had been working when a girl at his work asked him whether he had a girlfriend and he said 'I had one, come on, you know my ex - girlfriend', then she just walked away without saying anything.
feedback_explanation: Say may be better than "tell" here. "Tell" is used to say something specific to someone. "Say" is more general.

source: There are so many kinds of problems which the environmental pollution causes.
corrected: There are so many kinds of problems which [NONE] environmental pollution causes.
feedback_explanation: Since you are not referring to specific "environmental pollution" and it is a non-count noun, no article is needed.

source: Companies can create a site dedicated to introducing the value of the products, prices and services deals.
corrected: Companies can create a site dedicated to introducing the value of the products, prices and service deals.
feedback_explanation: When a noun modifies another noun, it should always be in the singular form.
feedback_suggestion: Change the word "services" to its singular form.

source: As long as I try to keep doing thing in an eco - friendly way, I realize that I am giving a little from my side and I feel I am caring for my environment.
corrected: As long as I try to keep doing things in an eco - friendly way, I realize that I am giving a little from my side and I feel I am caring for my environment.
feedback_explanation: Thing is singular here, but you are talking about doing more than one thing.

source: Then the friends could not fail to pay attention to the Alison's words.
corrected: Then the friends could not fail to pay attention to [NONE] Alison's words.
feedback_explanation: In general, do not use articles with proper nouns or nouns modified by proper nouns.

source: Kate was crying a lot but Michael run away.
corrected: Kate was crying a lot but Michael ran away.
feedback_explanation: It seems like this happened in the past, but "run" is not in a past tense form.

source: Quite often, I found it difficult to balance both my study and my hobbies at the same time.
corrected: Quite often, I found it difficult to balance both my studies and my hobbies at the same time.
feedback_explanation: Study should be plural here, not singular. Sometimes, "study" is an uncountable noun, but it is countable when talking about one's various efforts.

source: To answer this questions we have to analyze giving some positive and negative arguments.
corrected: To answer this question we have to analyze giving some positive and negative arguments.
feedback_explanation: Questions is plural, but "this" suggests there is only one.

source: Therefore, we are reforming and making high - tech items, likes LEDs, photoelectric, vacuum, steam mops, etc.
corrected: Therefore, we are reforming and making high - tech items, likes LEDs, photoelectric, vacuums, steam mops, etc.
feedback_explanation: Vacuum is singular here, but you seem to be talking about many.

source: Everyone is terrified and find out that a demon is attached to the doll.
corrected: Everyone is terrified and finds out that a demon is attached to the doll.
feedback_explanation: The subject "everyone" is singular, so the sentence needs a third-person singular verb.
feedback_suggestion: Change "find" to the third-person singular form.
